message:
Hello Geeks
i have an important question that need to discuss with all of you,,,
i am working as .NET developer ( ASP.NET / WF/WPF/SQL SERVER ) for 3 years, i was started to program as a hobbyist 4 years ago (self-study) depending on multiple resources (youtube,ebooks,articles,etc)
i was setting on my desk thinking about ( how to develop my career ) is that i need to take the related certifications and exams that relate to my specialist ?? or i would forget about that point and contribute in opensource projects ?? or just all i need to roll in the deep (not adele for sure :D) and read an advanced books in the software development in general ???
what's the point ?? how can advance my career ?

data.message:
I personally think certifications are a waste of time and money, participate in open source projects if you can, or make side projects, also make sure you work with people who are more experienced than you, and read a lot. 
The more hours you spend in actual projects are the ones that count, working with others and reading books will make sure you do the right things in these hours.
I add to what Mohamed Elsherif just said that you need to read books like "The Google Resume".

الموضوع متعلق بشخصيتك وعلى حسب انت عايز ايه بالظبط 
بمعنى انت عايز تبقى مبرمج في شركة وياترى نفسك تبقى مبرمج في شركة في مصر ولا عايز تسافر الخليج تشتغل مبرمج هناك ولا انت من هواة الفري لانسر سواء بقى عملاء هنا في مصر او على النت  من الاخر الموضوع متعلق باللي انت عايزه على اساسه هتحدد الطريق 
يعني لو عايز تدخل شركة مالتي ناشيونال ممكن الشهادات الدولية تبقى  لذيذة معاك لو عايز تبقى شركة برمجة في مصر الخبرة والبروجيكتس اللي عملتها هي اللي هتفرق اكتر معاك 
عايز فري لانسر وتشتغل مع نفسك يبقى شغلك وعلاقاتك

For me, 
1. Contribute in open source. 
2. Add more technologies to your portfolio like front end development (html, css, JavaScript, angularjs......) 
3. Go deep in the technologies that you already have.
4. Prepare for next level in your career by learning more about (software engineering, software architecture, project management)
